alert.note: Alert for Monroe Middle Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 11:19PM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Middle Keys in Monroe County through 1145 PM EDT... At 1118 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Duck Key to 7 miles south of Boot Key. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marathon, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Seven Mile Bridge, Long Key Viaduct, West End Of Long Key Viaduct, Duck Key, Conch Key, Boot Key, Grassy Key and Knight Key. This includes US 1 between mile markers 42 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
